page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.
page.content: The area is in County Durham, about three kilometres west of Darlington. The{geology}comprises Magnesian Limestone overlain by glacial drift. The height ranges from sixty metres to eighty seven metres, with a southerly aspect. The Cocker Beck runs south-easterly to join the Skerne at Darlington. The{landscape consists of gently undulating farmland, which is predominantly arable. There are only two{settlements which are to the north of the area, Denton GR 218189 and Walworth GR 233188. The major{communications}links are the B6279, which cuts across this area from north-west to south-east, and Dere Street, a Roman road which runs north to south.
